intro: Barkworthia stillmanii, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes. Barkworthia stillmanii is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against environmental stressors.
